We had to check out 2 days early due to illness in the family and that wasn't a problem - We have stayed at others in the areas on previous occasions and paid much more with very little service. We will definitely stay here again on return trips. Kudos to the staff at the Pavilion - thanks for making our stay pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us and your very kind review.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: This hotel is walking distance to Anaheim/Disney attractions (with a stroller with smaller children). The room was very nice and comfortable. My kids got a kick out of house keeping mixing up their toys. Nice larger pool with plenty of room for swimming. Staff was super freindly and helpful when we need a restroom faitly urgently upon check-in. We did not eat breakfast at the adjacent Denny's.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us at the Best Western Plus Pavilions.  We are happy you found our location and pool helpful during your stay and we look forward to see you on your next trip back to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Reserve Early, Get A Great Rate, Location & Stay
Summary: I spent 3 days here at the end of June to attend a conference at one of the Disneyland hotels.  Best Western has proven to be reliable in the past and I didn't want to spend the money asked for by the resort hotels, so I opted to stay at the Pavilions which is a quick 10-15 minute walk to the Disneyland hotels, Downtown Disney and the monorail entrance to Disneyland.  I made my reservation over 90 days ahead of my travel dates (before prices went up for summer) and got a rate less than $100/night (it was much higher by the time I checked in).  I only interacted with hotel staff when checking in and out, but they were both good experiences.  The people were very pleasant, energetic and helped me with finding my way to the conference site.  The hotel itself is an older, but very
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us.  We are happy you found our location and rooms helpful during your stay in Anaheim.  We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you again.

Summary: Following our trip across the states we stayed in many hotels including 4 other best-western, we found no real problems and where satisfied will all our hotels but our stay at the end of our trip in best west plus pavilions Anaheim!  We arrived late in the evening from a 4 hour drive and couldn't wait to settle down for the night but when we opened the door we noticed a terrible stench coming from within, i kicked my flip flops off closed door and went to investigate the smell and found the sink was covered in what looked like toe nails and skin also shavings from pubic region, my wife wasted no time and called the reception to have us changed,  whenever on leaving the room i noticed my feet was black with filthy dirt from the carpet!   We changed rooms and the next room was the
Manager Response: Thank you for completing your review. We do appreciate your patronage.

Summary: Hotel did not offer a continental breakfast, the room was dirty, the carpet was black! it stained our feet and socks black, their was bugs in the bathroom, the refrigerator didn't work very well and did not have a freezer with it and the coffee pot, if you want to call it that, did not work very well either.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us at the Best Western Plus Pavilions.  I do apologize we did not meet your expectations.  Thank you for completing your review. We do appreciate your patronage.

Summary: Great location near Disneyland, about a 20 minute walk. Denny's restaurant right next door which was handy, and also a Coco'a restaurant 5 minutes walk away (going towards Disney). Small but clean pool, plus a spa. Free in room wi fi. Free breakfast (coffee, muesli bars and fruit) Free safety deposit boxes in reception.  Large clean room, plenty of space. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us at the Best Western Plus Pavilions.  We are happy to know you found our pool and location helpful during your stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: There were HUGE cockroaches! Captured one and showed it to the front desk at checkout. They could not have cared less. Location is great if you're doing Disney, but if bugs creep you out like they do me, don't stay here!
Manager Response: Thank you for completing your review. We do appreciate your patronage.

Summary: My husband and I decided to stay down near Disneyland the night before going into the park. We were greeted at the BW Plus Pavilions immediately and with a smile. We were offered either a bottom floor room, or a top floor room. I asked for a top floor 'with a view'. We had a great view of the fireworks from Disneyland! The room was very clean and very comfortable. No noise. The next day I asked if we could leave our car until we returned that night. They said that it was fine, just leave up the parking permit they had given me the night before. We were not staying another night, so I didn't know if they would object, but they didn't. Parking was free. We walked to Disneyland from the hotel. An easy walk of about ten minutes. We cut across the  Disney employees parking lot
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We do appreciate your business and do hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Great price. Staff was very helpful. Within walking distance of Disney Resort, but why walk when you can jump on the bus right in front of the hotel. Only negatives were the room carpets...they need to be cleaned. Dont walk barefooted! The housekeepers took all the prime parking spots everyday, the spots near the stairs. (WHY??)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a review for our property.  We are pleased you enjoyed your stay.  We do look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: We felt that this hotel looked a little tired and in need of refurbishment. If it has a restaurant we were not told of it although there was a Denny's next door. The shuttle bus to Disney stopped right outside. It was OK for a couple of nights to visit Disney.
Manager Response: We do appreciate your time to complete the survey and your patronage.  We do hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: BETTER OPTIONS THOUGH CLOSE TO DISNEY
Summary: We haven stayed at Best Western Raffles at a better rate. They do not offer breakfast at this motel. It is however, walking distance through the back parking lot of the Disney hotel. Rooms were clean and the microwave, etc are a plus.
Manager Response: We do appreciate your business and time completing the review.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: The only concerns I had with this hotel was the lack of breakfast being available. They did give coupons that allowed children 10 and under to eat at Denys next door, but when you have children that want to go to Disney land, who has time to eat breakfast at a restaurant !!
Manager Response: We do appreciate your business, although we do not have breakfast at this time we will within the next two years so we do hope you will come see us again.

Summary: My husband and I traveled to Disneyland and had a free stay at a Best Western (Thanks to work). I was not expecting too much, but overall our 4 nights with Best Western were good. The rooms on the first floor were quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms are something that could be upgraded, but overall, we were pleased. We knew we were not staying at a 5 star hotel and didn't expect 5 star service. The pool and hot tub area were in the parking lot, but actually very well kept. This hotel is within walking distance of Disney, which is a plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to complete your review.  We do hope when your travels bring you to our area again we can serve as your lodging needs.

Summary: I stayed here with my husband and son for 4 nights, as a base for Disneyland. We were not disappointed with the quality, location and value. The rooms are fairly basic, but with everything you could need, and the staff were friendly and helpful. We used the pool one afternoon that we didn't go into the park, and it was a great temperature, nice and clean, with towels and drinks nearby. The Disney shuttle stops by here, and my son still calls it his "holiday house"
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for your patronage, and for completing a review.  We do hope you will return as our guest again.

Summary: Good Hotel to stay at when going to Disneyland and California Adventure. It is nice that kids eat free at Denny's with paying adult.  Not a bad walk to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, or California Adventure.
Manager Response: Thank you for completing this review and your patronage.  We do look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: The Air conditioner was loud, the guest next door kept slamming the door every 30 minutes and the hotel staff was next door, and they never stopped it.  There were pubic  hairs and human hairs on the sheets  gross!  The room smelled bad, smelled very old and musty. Did not sleep at all. I We have stayed in this hotel many times in the past with no complaints, but this last stay was so awful, that we will never stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for completing your review.  We do appreciate your patronage.

Summary: Stayed one night after a long day at Disneyland. Slept well but i will attribute that to the exhaustion of walking around Disneyland all day. We were on the top floor and found it very noisy. Was fine for a one night stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your patronage,  we do hope to see you again.

Summary: I am saying to avoid this hotel in particular and Best Western in general.  I booked my stay for OCTOBER 2014, through Hotels.com the beginning of March. Yesterday, (middle of May) I noticed an authorization hold on my account from the hotel.  Upon calling I was rudely informed that it is a new best western policy that they authorize even a small amount, to make sure you show up. When I said I was going to cancel and inform Hotels.com of this "new policy", and that I would not be staying or recommending a Best Western again...EVER, she (with attitude) said fine, and hung up. No offer to speak to a manager, nothing.  Obviously Best western is doing so well, and they share their profit outlook with ALL their employees, that she felt confident that my refusal to stay didn't concern
Manager Response: In regards to you booking, you credit card was authorized $1.00.  This is to check the validity of the credit card, as guest making bookings with our hotel must have valid credit cards on file to hold the room. It also ensures that there is not a error in the credit card number itself.    This is not a Best Western policy, this is our policy.   We are sorry that this $1.00 authorization has prompted you to cancel your booking.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 night from the 27/04/2014. the Reception Staff were very helpful when we checked. The room was very clean and pleasant. they are a short walk to Disneyland. Pool and Spa Area was very well maintained
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again!!

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, clean but rooms are hot/humid on arrival.
Summary: Nice place to stay, reasonably close to Disneyland and the price via Hotwire was descent. My only complaint so far is the rooms are very hot and humid on arrival when staying during summer months. The small A/C unit is turned off when you arrive and it takes a very long time to cool down! I'm sweating as I type this and I've been here about two hours now. I advize that you check in as soon as possible and crank the A/C! Then go out and enjoy you day, hopefully your room will be cool when you return.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, and taking the time to complete this review.  We do hope to see you again!!

Summary: This hotel is an older 2 storey walk up. Staff inquired as to a preference to stay on the ground level or the upper floor. The ground floor would be better if anyone has trouble with stairs or had  lot of heavy luggage. The rooms are older and basic but clean, and the staff were very efficient and friendly. It was hot during our stay and we had to have the air conditioner on all night. It was an old air conditioning unit and was quite noisy so sleeping wasn't great. The hotel is across the street from a Disney staff parking lot. We walked from the hotel and cut through the parking lot and it took about 15 - 20 minutes to get to the main gate. We went to the pool late one afternoon to cool off and it was very clean and there were fresh towels provided.
Manager Response: We appreciate your patronage and do appreciate your review.  We hope to see you again!!

Summary: This was my first time staying at this Best Western. I usually stay at one of the two at the entrance to Disneyland. This hotel was also within waking distance to Disneyland, which I liked.  The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and my check in was quick.  I ask for a bottom floor room and received it.  The only thing that put me off about this hotel was the dark green color. It is not very inviting.  I will stay there again on one of my many visits to Disneyland.  I have already recommended this hotel to others who frequent Disneyland and that area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our first trip to Disneyland with 1yr old and 5 yr old... wed-sun...stayed in room 151... it was humid upon arrival... next day I was in shower and the bathroom was flooding... told maintanece they came right away and discovered rooms 148-151 were all that way... GROSSSSSSS I was talking a shower is sewer water..... so the manager appolgized and gave a us a new room to shower in but not change rooms due to they was gonna fix the problem.... so the next day it happened again..... SOOOOOOOOOO discussed by this point... they gave us a little gift bag and comp.. out last night there..... still our little ones were walking on flooded carpet and having to run to dennys in middle of night to go to the bathroom is WRONG......I hope they replace the caperts so mold and sewer water is
Manager Response: It is our goal to provide superior guest service to all of our guests and unfortunately from time to time plumbing problems do occur.   We did give you the option to move rooms which was declined therefore we gave you a second complimentary room along with other compensation for your troubles.  We are sorry that this happened during your stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here for 10nights in April, we had a upstairs room. We found the room very clean and comfortable. We also orgainsed Disney/universal/seaworld tickets from the hotel, which were at a discounted price compared to buying tickets at the gate. Disneyland is about 15minute slow walk to the gate, walk across the road through the Disney carpark towards Disney hotel. On the way back try dinner at coco's, its on the same road as hotel, on the corner just past dennys, the best meal and a fantastic price. Also if you are staying not in school holiday times or booking along way out , make sure you ask for a discount before you book, we got about 15% discount. We will 100% come back, loved it  Thankyou best western
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay with us.  We do hope to see you again next time your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary: While staying here my daughter had a medical issue in the middle of the night that sent us to the E.R.  I called the office for info on nearby medical facilities and got Tom who could not have been more helpful and caring.   All the employees that I dealt with during our stay were polite and efficient but Tom was exceptional.  Good clean rooms, very comfortable beds, good customer service.  Also very convenient that there is a Denny,s and a great mini-mart just steps away.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, we do appreciate your business.  We do look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Looking for an inexpensive place to stay after a long day? Look no further but this hotel. Overall great stay. Clean room & comfortable bed, everything you need after a long day in Disneyland! Love this hotel and will defiantly stay in it again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review.  We hope when your travels bring you to the area again you will choose our hotel again for your lodging needs.

Summary: The Best Western PLUS Pavilions located in Anaheim, California, is an outstanding value. The rooms were clean as well as comfortable. The staff was friendly as well as welcoming. Disneyland is just a few blocks away, so you can walk there in a short amount of time.
Manager Response: Thank your for being our guest, we do appreciate your business and review.

Summary: Excellent hotel very clean lovley poolside. Rooms spotless complimentry tea and coffee when ever  yoy want. Close to disney land. Stayed here 8 days and the staff were excellent !!!! They went out of their way to help you. I will be returning . Once again a big thanks to the all the staff.  christine mcardle
Manager Response: We do hope we will see you again.  We appreciate the time you spent with us and the review.

Summary: For the most part the stay was fine.  Walking distance to the park. While no breakfast is included with this hotel there is a Denny's right on site. Enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi, and workout room. Price was good for our budget.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We do appreciate your business and review.  We do hope you will choose us again for your lodging needs next time you are in the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary: The hotel is with in walking distance to the convention center.  We stay at the Main gate Best Westerns if we are going to Disneyland but enjoy this one for business.  There is a Denny's restaurant on site.  The pool and jacuzzi are big, nice, and clean.  The beds are not comfortable for me since I prefer a softer bed but the rooms are clean and well kept.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  We will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We are pleased to ready you enjoyed your time here.  We do hope to see you again.

Summary: First time in USA and this is the first hotel. Great Room, close to Disneyland. Spa is great after tired walking in Disneyland. Helpful staff. Internet is very poor, It is good if there was a toaster and hot water kettle in the room. Had to buy a toaster.
Manager Response: We are pleased to read your comments, we do appreciate the time to complete the survey and also for staying with us.  Hopefully we will serve as your lodging needs again when your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary Heading: Try not to stay in this hotel
Summary: The first room was really bad odor like ashes, I went back to the front desk and they told me try another room, the second room was not that really bad odor but still some weird odor in the room. The internet wifi was not working, odor in refrigerator, spider webs all around the air conditioning unit. Odor in room, no internet (wifi), spider webs, odor in refrigerator, dirty microwave,....
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review for our property.  We do appreciate your patronage.

Summary Heading: Value for moneyaccomodation close to Disneyland
Summary: The Best Western PLUS Pavilions was great value considering the close proximity to Disneyland - 15 mins walk. Across the road, through the car park and up Disney Way (shopping area). I'm sure the staff can draw you a map. The return walk was not even daunting at 11:30pm after a full Disney day with a 6yr old! If you don't wish to walk there are shuttles available every 15 - 20 mins, local & private, again enquire at the desk.  The only downside was noise from early departing guests above, so book a 2nd floor room and some car mechanical noise, not sure if there is a garage next door?  Denny's was next door and had an adequate menu for our party. Kids dine free with a paying adult with a voucher. Apples are available at the front desk, if you need to run to the fun.   The rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We are pleased to read your review that you have taken the time to complete.  We do hope when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort area you will choose us for your lodging needs again.

Summary Heading: Everything in this hotel, and the property are super clean.
Summary: We booked this hotel because it was very affordable.  Happily , the rooms were very clean and quiet( we were at the back building). The pool area was spotless.  Kids under 10 eat free at Denny's ( which is located in the shared parking lot). Our 'free' wifi did not work at all.  That was a little disappointing. But, that way we kept our focus on Disneyland.  It is a good hike from the park.  Suggest cutting through The Grand Californian's lobby to Downtown Disney which leads onto the gate area of the Disneyland property.  So, if you have little ones find transport.  Our youngest is 10 and after a full day... It was a long slow haul back to the hotel.  The front desk staff were helpful and efficient. When we arrived there was a change needed for our room( a booking issue NOT a
Manager Response: Thank your for staying with us and taking the time to complete the review.  We do appreciate your business and do hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: A comfortable hotel in a good location
Summary: This is a nice hotel with good rooms: comfortable, clean, roomy, and quiet. The hotel has only two floors, and therefore has the feel of a motel—but a good motel. The staff was friendly and efficient. I didn't have a car, but the lot appears to have a high capacity: there were still spaces available even with a large convention (and Disneyland) going on. There is a nice 24-hour Denny's adjacent to the hotel. The location is excellent for both the Convention Center (an easy 15-minute walk) and Disneyland. The walk to Disneyland is a little farther; an option to walking is to take the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit), which makes trips between the hotel and Disneyland every 20 minutes. Pavilions is very much like the very good Best Western Stovall's Inn, five minutes down the street.
Manager Response: We do appreciate your business and the time to complete this survey.  We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: BEST place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was perfect! We stayed for 4 nights during the first week of spring break (2 adults 2 children) and we were given a mangers special rate of $92 per night parking and Wi-Fi included (other places I seen charge for parking, Wi-Fi). Microwave and refrigerator in the rooms was a plus for our late night snacks. I loved the feather pillows and the bed was very comfortable, I slept like a baby! Dennys was right next door and we were given plenty of "kids eat free" coupons that can be used anytime which really helped (we're a family of 4 and ate for about $20 everytime with the coupons!) The staff were all extremely kind and addressed all matters promptly. Everything looks EXACTLY like the pictures! Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and smelled fresh. The maid always left
Manager Response: We are pleased to read your review.  Thank you for staying with us and completing this review.  We do hope when your travels bring you to this area again we can serve as your lodging needs.

Summary Heading: So close to disney you can almost smell it
Summary: A good hotel which looks more like a motel since the most of the rooms are close to the street. It's a 15 minute walk to downtown disney. overall it's a super location when going to disney.  Hotel: Nice hotel with nice rooms.  Price: The price is good for what you get, good accommodation with free parking.  Room:  The room is spacious enough, the AC unit didn't really work propperly which was disappointing. Next to that people walk past your door and cars park nearby which might cause some noise. For the rest a good room.  bathroom: Good bathroom, nothing to comment on this.  Services: They give the option to buy tickets for for disney from the reception, This  is only for 2+ days.  neighborhood: Close to disney on a 15min walk.  Parking: Free parking with enough spaces.
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Pavilions hotel, thank you for staying with us.  We do appreciate your business and review.  We hope to see you again!!

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with our room. The beds were super comfortable, the room was clean and the bathroom appeared to be relatively newly remodeled-no mold, granite in the sink area. As others have noted you can walk to Disneyland through a parking lot across the street. The staff was very nice, allowing me to park in their lot. There is a heated pool and jacuzzi. You can get coupons at the front desk for children's meals at Denny's, "buy an adult entree, get a kids meal free." If you're military check with you local MWR for a voucher.
Manager Response: Thank your for staying with us.  We do hope to see you again!!

Summary: The staff is very friendly and very clean. I would stay there again, and I would recommend my family and friends as well. It is right across from Disney Land and you can park there and ride the Bus that drops you off at the front and do not have to mess with parking you Car..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review for our hotel.  We do appreciate your business and hope to see you again!!

Summary: Overall, I liked this hotel it was close to Disneyland. I went there to check out the area because I'll be running a race there in August and wanted to get familar with the area. It has a Denny's right next door and was within walking distance to the Disneyland campus. I liked it and the room was comfortable and reasonably priced.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your patronage.  We hope to have you as our guest again at the Best Western Plus Pavilions Hotel.

Summary: I really do love this hotel. It is what I would call a mid range price hotel but it is close to Disneyland, the staff could not be better and Dennys is right next door nice for a family breakfast. I have stayed several times and have had no problems at all
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We appreciate your business.

Summary: very helpful service. i'm a patient guy. about a block down from Disneyland. Denny's restaurant literally in the parking lot. family enjoyed the night stays. wanted to try the pool area but didn't have time to head test the waters. very good and affordable place.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Best Western Plus Pavilions.  We appreciate your business.

Summary: Nothing fancy but we were here for Disneyland not the motel room. We were looking for clean rooms, comfortable beds and a great location. We got it all here!  We will be staying here the next time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your business, we do hope if you travel in this area again we can serve as your lodging needs.

Summary: Pros: very comfortable bed and high quality bedding.  Disneyland tickets and Anaheim resort transit passes available at the hotel front desk.  Disneyland park shuttle stops right at the hotel. Cons:  slow internet, and filthy carpet.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, we do appreciate your business.

Summary: Nothing glamorous, but functional for business trip to Anaheim/Disneyland area. Free parking and walking distance to Convention center. Price is a good value for the room and location. Cannot comment on food or anything else.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly and close to Disney
Summary: Went with family.  Got to hotel early and they were happy to store our bags so we could get over to Disneyland.  Park is a 15 minute walk across the street.  The bus stop is also right in front of the hotel, but it would probably take longer to wait, etc. A great food mart/liquor store is right next door.  Don't be intimidated by it also being a liquor store - they have milk, cereal, snacks and half the price you are going to pay at Disney and  they are really nice and helpful.  If you stay at the hotel, kids eat free at the Denny's next door for any meal. They hotel also has fruit/coffee and granola bars at the desk in the morning.   Hotel was clean.  Rooms were nice, beds comfy. Noise?  Of course, it's a hotel!  We slept with a fan on and it drowned out any noise and we slept
Manager Response: none

Summary: My hubby and I stay at this facility several times per year (for Disneyland trips).  It is VERY convienent to the theme parks, generally quiet and reasonably priced.    There has been recent upgrades to the rooms.  The bathrooms are refreshed with paint, new windows, toilets and tub surrounds.  Very nice!    I would reccomend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here twice now and have been impressed both times.  It is a no-frills hotel, but is clean, comfortable, and close enough to Disneyland to walk.  The beds are great.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The Wondermart next door was super convenient and the staff there was very friendly.  Marri's italian restaurant had great pizza and was a welcome change from park food.

Summary Heading: Really Budget Friendly and Worth It!
Summary: We booked this hotel through WestJet vacations on the Kids Fly Free program on the very last day of the promotion.  I had a choice of this hotel, the Sheraton, the Clarion and the Doubletree. I chose this one because of the Tripadvisor ratings it received.  What I have come to realize is that all hotel rooms are just that.  You pay basically for elevators and fancy lobbies elsewhere.  This is definitely a motel, but a very well kept one.  The room was a decent size, clean and the beds were very comfortable!  Just as other reviewers had said.  There was a bit of noise with the garbage disposal one morning, but other than that, it was quiet.  We were able to watch the fireworks from our second floor balcony as well - which was much better than staying late at Disneyland to do the
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your patronage at the Best Western Plus Pavilions Hotel.

Summary: A friend and I stayed here for the first time over Labor Day weekend, and were impressed. We were running in the Disneyland Half Marathon early Sunday morning, and we requested a 2nd floor room away from the road so we could go to bed early without being disturbed, and that's exactly what we got at check in. The rooms were very nice and clean, and the beds were sooo comfortable. Additionally, they were very accommodating of our weird schedules. On the day we left, my friend had a late flight, and they not only permitted us to check out an hour late, but gave us new key cards with pool-only access so we could swim and sit by the pool until it was time to leave. We will definitely go back, as we've decided that this is the perfect race-weekend hotel.
Manager Response: We are so pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We hope that we see you again next year for the next marathon.  We thank you for your patronage.

Summary: My mom and I stayed here from September 17-Septermber 24. When we checked in there were a couple of minor problems that were fixed in two seconds. I asked for a room on first floor because my mom uses a walker. It was not only already taken care of but we got a handicap room with a handicap bathroom. My mom was able to sit in the shower. We had no problem parking the rental car. The staff was great. I called for a wake up call that was a few minutes late but even that was not such a big thing. At night you could see the fireworks from Disneyland. I would recommend staying here. Also the rooms are kept very clean.

The staff at the desk are friendly and helped us book a trip to Universal Studios Hollywood. There's no free continental breakfast, but there is a Denny's next door. Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We do hope that when your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area again you will join us again as our guest.

Really soured me on this place.  Others just as convient and they may have problem solvers at the front desk?

Summary Heading: Great price for the close distance to Disneyland!

We crossed the street and cut through the cast member parking lot which led right to the Disneyland Hotel.  This shortcut took about 10 minutes to get to the park entrance, and only about 5 minutes to Downtown Disney.  We're from Orlando and know you cannot find any hotel so close to Disney property for this price.    We also had a view of the fireworks from the room!  We would return here in the future!

Summary: Just returned from a 3-night stay.  It was great.  Didn't hear a complaint from my 14-year-old hotel snob niece who doesn't like to stay at exterior corridor places.  Beds were comfortable, it was roomy, nice big mirror over the sink, outer vanity.  Bathroom was on the small side, but no problem.  Being on the 2nd floor, I just cracked the window for air in the bathroom.  Set A/C to energy efficient so it didn't run all the time, plus it helped mask ouside noises, which were infrequent, except at 8 in the morning when people were leaving.  Didn't hear noises next door.  One hint, if you want the room dark in the morning before you get up, close the bathroom door at night.  With the window, a lot of light comes in once the sun comes up.  I would definitely stay here again. t
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a room with two beds, but when we checked in they gave us a room with one bed. Someone had changed our reservation and didn't contact us. As we needed the two beds, one of us ended up sleeping on a roll-a-way. They said we could come back the next day - to resolve this issue and move to a new room, but they were booked up on the night of our arrival. This would disrupt our trip to Disneyland twice in one day and we decided it wasn't worth the hassle. We felt that they were very dishonest about the situation and we will not return as we don't feel a guest is guaranteed the number of beds when booking  a room. We have never had an issue with Best Western until now; however, we will not be returning to this location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel. Will stay here again.
Summary: I spent hours researching hotels and found the Best Western Pavilions and I am very happy I did. This hotel was great. Good location (we did have rental car so not sure about other transportation options) clean room, great staff.  This hotel was perfect.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your patronage, we are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to having you as our guest again, when your travels bring your to the Anaheim Resort Area!!

Summary: A family of 4, with 2 kids.Just stayed there for 6 nights. The advance booking rate was very attractive. 15 minute walk through the parking lot to the Park and returned by taxis (just $6-$8) since our legs were tired after a long day. Denny's restaurant and a small grocery store Wonderland are conveniently located next to the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The beds are super comfortable and we all slept well. Our room has flat screen TV which is good. Wi-Fi is complimentary and fast. The swimming pool and hot tub is good and we enjoyed the swim very much. The only downsides are the A/C is a little bit noisy and the bathroom is very small and without a fan. Overall, a good value hotel.
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff and management I would like to thank you for your patronage.  We are pleased to know that your enjoyed your stay!!!

Summary: I am a nurse/germaphobe the rooms where clean and very comfortable with plenty of storage.the staff was very friendly gave us a 1st floor room because we have small children. No noise issues,free parking. 9 ft pool clean covered table to eat snacks. towel bin with plenty of towels and restrooms poolside.We stayed at the hyatt in LA the next night and it was not near as comfortable.  Cons: flat screen tv would have completed the room. Faucet in the shower was hard to figure out. Do not eat pizza from strip next door greasy and bland.
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff and management we would like to thank you for being a guest at our hotel.  We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay.  We do hope you continue to use Best Western's for all your lodging needs.  Just to let you know our hotel is about 60% converted to flat screen tv's, and hopefully by the end of the year all our rooms will be converted over to flat screens.  We hope to see you and your family soon!!!

Summary: We stayed here for a Disney trip with our family of 4 (2 adults, 1 child, 1 toddler) and enjoyed it very much.  I have stayed in quite a few hotels in the Disney area, and for the price this place is close to the top!  The walk was just a mite longer than the Paradise pier, about 10-15 min for fast/moderate walkers, 20 for slowpokes.  The Denny's close by had very good breakfast food for a fraction of what you would pay in the park, and you can order to go and bring it back to your room.  The small liquor store next to the hotel has fruit, cereal, juice, milk and different breakfast pastries as well.  They also sell a 6 pack of Dasani water for 5 bucks - you pay$3 per bottle inside Disneyland - big savings!!!  The hotel itself was very clean, and I am very picky about how clean
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for being our guest at the Best Western Plus Pavilions Hotel.  We are so pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights, 1 room with two queen beds. Rooms were clean, well maintained and the beds were extremely comfortable. Pillows were fluffy; instead of the standard two pillows per bed we had four per bed. The bedding was soft, not scratchy like at most hotels. Employees were very friendly and helpful. The only down side to the room, I was on the lower lever and could hear the guests above us walking around but it wasn’t a huge issue as they were not up all night. Location is a short walk near Downtown Disney; we choose to take the ART shuttle which stops right outside the hotel at the bus stop. Denny’s is conveniently located right next to the hotel. Rooms have a microwave and fridge, although I would suggest not going to the liquor mart next to
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff and management we would like to thank you for giving us the oppurtunity to serve as your lodging needs while traveling in the resort area.  We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights, two rooms, two families.  The rooms were very clean. Maint. responds right away. And it appeared to be fully booked. The discount tickets, ie children under 10 eat free at Dennys on the property worked very well. So everyone had a nice breakfast with full choices. That is one child per paying adult. We had a minor issue about the booking that was handled at the counter. Make sure you have "all" your paper work with you. Anaheim taxes are high. 17 pct and a 5.00 per day resort fee. You can park for free at the hotel and walk to Downtown Disney in about 15 minutes. No reason to park at Disney for 15.00 per day if you stay here. The property grounds and the pool area are very clean. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and might use this Best Western

Summary: I have stayed at the Best Western Pavillions twice.  Both were pleasent stays.  The girls at the front desk were friendly and knowledgeable on the local area.  We walked to and from Disneyland for three days.  It is an easy walk and takes around 10 - 15 minutes.  The first time we stayed we were on the top floor, and the second time we were on the ground floor.  It was much quieter on the top floor - you didn't have the noise coming from the top floor.  Housekeeping do a fantasitc job, and the rooms were always lovely and clean.  The room provides fridge/microwave, so we bought groceries and made our own breakfast in the room before heading out for the day.  There is no laundry on site, however you are able to use the laundry facility of a neightbouring BW.  Havind Denny's in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were very happy with our stay at Best Western Pavilions.  Service was good checking in and out.  The room was large and clean with a microwave and fridge.  Beds were comfortable. There is no continental breakfast, but   they do give vouchers for kids to eat free with an adult meal purchase at Denny's.  We'd be happy to stay here another time.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The perfect place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed in the "Family suite", which is on the second floor and has one king bed on one side and three double beds lined up on the other side.  The two sides are separated by one of those accordion-style sliding dividers.  There are two full bathrooms and two TVs and two air conditioner/heater units.  It is perfect for families or for a bunch of friends.  The beds are firm and very comfortable, and each bed has extra pillows.  Housekeeping kept the room spotless, so it was very nice to come "home" to after days at Disneyland.  The hotel also has a pool and hot tub that are kept neat and clean.  Disneyland is very close - a 20-minute walk or 5-minute shuttle ride.  We were very, very satisfied!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place to stay with kids, staff is very friendly
Summary: We looked everywhere to find a place big enough for 6 people in one room that would not cost us an arm and leg to stay and this was it, the room was great it was above the office so our little kids could be themselfs and not worry about the noise. The staff was good to us and great to the kids. Rooms were very clean. we are staying again this year in the same room. The only thing I wish they had was an elevator, because the stairs were a little difficult for my mother to climb and my brother to climb other than that it was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a hidden surprise; it is not on the main track as the other Disney Hotels but is about a 15 minute walk or you can take the shuttle. Front Desk Staff are well informed, friendly and willing to help Maintenance and cleaning staff are friendly and professional Rooms are older decor but very neat; since it is not on the main track you can get a good nights sleep as it is very quiet. I stay in alot of hotels but have never had as good of sleeps as this one. Pool is small and in the parking lot, I found it kind of cool but my wife and son did not; as they were in it many a day. If you want a good restaurant their is a Denny's next door which serves huge breakfasts and a very good Italian Restaurant (Marri's) some of the biggest pizza's I have ever seen plus they make

Summary: We have been making yearly trips to Disneyland for about 6 years now and have finally found a winner.  This hotel is affordable and has the best customer service I have ever experienced.  The front desk staff was very knowledgable about the area and surrounding areas.  The room was the cleanest one I've stayed in in my entire life.  The pool and pool area was extremely clean.  I definitely cannot wait until our trip next year.  This is definitely the best hotel in the Disneyland Resort area.

Summary Heading: Pretty nice hotel wish there was a continental breakfast
Summary: Pulling into the parking lot we were a little concerned about this older ugly green hotel but inside the rooms are renovated nicely and very clean.  Girls at the desk were friendly and helpful - there are even warm cookies at the desk!  The downstairs room we stayed in was fairly quiet.  We heard others just a couple of times through the night.  No traffic noise at all.  If we didn't have small children we would have walked to Disney and I believe it would have taken us about 15 minutes.  The shuttle runs often and was conveinient.  Disney parking is a nightmare, don't use it!  The things we were disappointed with was the beds were pretty small and too firm, the pool was chilly and the jacuzzi wasn't quite hot enough and there was no continental breakfast.  Even though it was

It is thru candid comments such as your own that we gain insight on our guest's overall experience, and we do hope that in the future when your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area you will continue to use Best Western Hotels for your lodging needs.

Summary: We spent 3 nights at this hotel. With the exception of checking in and checking out, we had little interactions with the staff. The trip was booked thru Costco and the rooms were prepaid. This hotel is OLD, they have kept it up well, but it is still old and you will notice it... BAD: AC Wall Unit – Sounds like a small engine when it was on. Windows – Single Pane, noise from outside and next door could be heard. Rooms - Small with little room to move for party of 4.  TV – Old Tube and fuzzy at times. Reception issues also. Pool – Cold and located inside parking lot. Bathrooms – Smaller and cramp. GOOD:  Location - Close to Disneyland (15 min walk) Price - moderate Bed – Comfortable
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us.  Guest feedback is our number one tool to gain insight on the overall guest experience.  Sounds like you were in a room that hasn't had the tv or air unit replaced.  We are in the process of replacing these items in our guest rooms on a as needed basis.  Thank you for being a guest at the Best Western Plus Pavilions Hotel.

Summary Heading: Easy walk to Disneyland, great value!
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions and have been very pleased both times. The staff are friendly, the rooms are nice enough and the facilities are okay (there is no on-site laundry however). An added bonus is the fresh-baked cookies at the front desk! Denny's is right next door and is open 24 hours a day. The great thing about this hotel is price and superb location!! Disneyland, Downtown Disney and California Adventure Park are only a short walk away! Just cross the road and walk through a  car-parking area and you will arrive in Downtown Disney :) This is definitely a 'great value for money' hotel!
Manager Response: Let me start out by thanking you for continuing to be a valued return guest.  We are so pleased to know you have enjoyed your stays with us here at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.  We hope to have you as our guest in future travels to the resort area.  Thank you for your continued patronage.

Summary Heading: Some of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights over Christmas 2010 and was very impressed.  This is a delightful and well run hotel, the staff were very friendly and efficient.  The room was well appointed, nothing fancy, but the bed was SUPER comfortable.  The best I slept on in my 3 weeks through travelling through the US.  Not the closest hotel to Disneyland, you could walk it if you wanted but the shuttle stopped right outside and ran quite frequently.  It was also good having the Denny's on the premises, made for an easy breakfast in the mornings.  The food was actually very good (for what it was) they seemed to really take care in what they served.  My only comment is that we sometimes did have trouble connecting to the Wi-Fi, I assume becasue there were so many people using it at the time.
Manager Response: On behalf of all the staff and mangement, I would like to thank you for being our guest at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.  We are happy to read your staff with us was a good experience for you.  We hope to see you return as our guest next time your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary: I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, which was about 20 minutes of walking distance from the hotel.  The hotel room was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable and had me sleeping like a baby throughout the night. Even though my room faced the car park, I did not hear any noises from the traffic or cars. The only con about it was the air-conditioning which was not working very well and hence it felt slightly cold at night. It made a noise as well, but not to the extent that it disturbed my sleep.   The staff is also very friendly and prompt with their service and very willing to assist you in every way they can. I asked them so many questions on my first night there about the attractions and transport and they patiently answered each and every
Manager Response: We are so pleased to read that you stay with us was a good one.  We also would like to thank you for your comments as we love to hear feedback from our guests wether it be good or bad.  We do look forward to having you as our guest again when your travels bring you to the resort area.  Thanks for being a valued guest!!

Summary Heading: Really impressed, would definitely stay here again
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights from Nov 21 in a 2nd floor room, front building.  Was really happy with the cleanliness of the room (and I'm pretty fussy about hotel rooms being super clean).  The beds were big and really comfortable so we had a great sleep every night.  There was very little noise at night either from traffic or other guests which was a plus, as we were really tired after doing the parks all day.  Our room didn't have a flat screen TV but not a problem as we were out all day anyway.  The pool area was really nice and well maintained and we loved the hot spa pool after walking all day.  The swimming pool wasn't warm enough for me to swim in but my son didn't seem to mind.  The staff in reception were all friendly and really helpful especially when we wanted directions
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for staying with us at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel, and are so pleased to know you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to serve as your lodging needs again next time your travels bring you the the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary Heading: Nice Motel! Good staff and Clean rooms
Summary: I have stayed here twice in tthe last month and have a reservation for this comming weekend. (Going to work for the mouse) The first time the room was nice. Had a nice flat screen TV and a newer A/C unit.  When I returned two weeks ago got a little older room with an older Picture Tube TV. No really big deal, but I really liked having the newer TV as the picture was alot better and clearer as I was in the room doing some work.  On the work note, the free wifi is Great! The staff is very nice and will let you check in early if there are rooms available. I would recomend this BW motel if you are looking for a clean and safe place to stay. I left at 3;30am when I checked out and found a security gaurd walking the pathways. Kinda cool.  Give this place a try. You might get one of
Manager Response: We are pleased you continue to stay with us as our valued guest.  Thank you for the feedback regarding your stays with us, and to let you know we are in the process of changing out all our televisions, soon we will have all guest rooms with the new flat screen tv's.  On behalf of all the staff and management here at the Best Western Pavilions we want to thank you for being our valued guest, and look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Stayed a night when visiting Disney parks.  Great basic property - would stay again and recommend without hesitation.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your patronage and are pleased to read that your stay with us at the Best Western Pavilions was enjoyable.  We hope to have you return as our valued guest again when your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary Heading: Good price, good location, updated rooms, great stay
Summary: Stayed here for a conference and then went with the family to Disneyland. About a 15 minute walk to Disneyland - could see the fireworks off our hotel balcony at night! The room seemed to have been updated recently - carpet, linens, bathroom fixtures all looked new. The pool was nicely kept up. The staff were responsive. Free parking and free wireless. Would definitely stay here again - especially for the price of $110 a night!
Manager Response: We are so pleased to read that you enjoyed your stay as our guest at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.  Our hotel has recently been renovated inside and out, and we are happy to read our recent renovations are to your liking.  We look forward to having you and your family return as a valued guest anytime your are traveling in the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary: My sister and I had the best possible experience in this hotel. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and the beds were so comfortable. I was very impressed as it was really cheap to book. Comfortable walking distance to Disneyland and had a Denny's in the carpark. I will be staying there the next time I visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff and management at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel, we would like to thank you for being our guest, we are pleased to know you and your sister had a great experience while staying with us.  Guest feedback is always welcomed as we pride ourselves in superior guest service, and we hope that you will continue to stay with us when your travels bring you to the Disneyland area.  We truly value each and every guest we have stay with us.

Summary Heading: clean & comfortable...I'll be back for sure : )
Summary: Pavilions Best Western is a great place to stay - my room was immaculately clean, the bed & pillows were super confortable, the staff was friendly & accomodating (they honored my request for a second floor room & allowed me an extra hour in the room on the day I checked out), the ART bus picked up & dropped off right in front of the hotel, and, for a place so close to Disneyland, the price was right!  The grounds are landscaped with large palm trees, umbrella trees, and banana trees, which surround the pool area. There's a hot tub next to the pool, which was nice to soak in after walking all day. There's a Denny's restaurant onsite & a WONDERFUL Italian restaurant  (Marri's) in the shopping center next door. I had a perfect view of the Disneyland fireworks from the window of my
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.  It's great to know our valued guest's opinions regarding their stays to ensure the highest level of guest service is being offered in all aspects of your stay with us, from guest service to room accommodations.  We look forward to your return stay with us, and hope you'll return and enjoy your time as our guest for many more years to come.

Summary: My son and I stayed at the Best Western Pavilions for three nights on a long weekend getaway to Disneyland.  It is a motel style property, but well maintained.  The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful when we checked in, making beach recommendations and accommodating our slightly early arrival and request for a room towards the rear of the property.  Our room looked as if it had been recently renovated.  It was very clean, the carpet looked brand new, and the bathroom was sparkling.  The sink outside the bathroom made it easy for one of us to groom while the other was in the shower.  There was also a refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker in that area of the room.  We slept very soundly in the comfortable beds - our room was toward the rear of the property on
Manager Response: We are so pleased to know you and your son enjoyed your stay with us at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.  We want to thank you for your comments and patronage, and hope to have you as our guest again!!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Excellent service and Value for money
Summary: My family and i stayed here for 9 days in august and were more than impressed with best western. We found everyone very friendly, in particular the girls working in reception, they were welcoming and very helpful. we did'nt drive while in LA so they arranged the best and cheapest transport and tours for us.The location was spot on with disney a short walk away and knotts berry farm a 20 minute drive ( we paid $20 flat rate fare) rooms were clean with everything they described on there website.

I am so pleased to know your stay with us was enjoyable.  Hopefully we will have the pleasure of serving as your lodging needs again when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area.  On behalf of all staff and management we are happy we were able to make your vacation a pleasurable time.

Summary: this was a nice little motel. I would stay here again. rooms were clean beds were a little worn. pool was  clean and well supplied. about a 10 minute walk to downtown disney 15 to the park.

Summary: Stay here for a great location to Disneyland - it's a 15 min walk to the park entrance, and you end up walking thru the car park. General area is quite good area of LA. Pool is good and provides towels, good for decent swimmers, but goes to 9ft, so take care with less confident swimmers.   Staff are very pleasant and helpful.
Manager Response: We are so pleased to read your stay was enjoyable with us.  We thank you for your patronage and hope you will continue to be our guest at the Best Western Pavilions hotel when traveling to the Anaheim Resort Area.  We look forward to seeing you again!!!

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights while touring California.  The hotel was clean but quite basic.  I was concerned when we first arrived as all the rooms are accessible from outside but we had no problems.  The rooms themselves are small and basic.  Beds are small but very comfortable.  The hotel is on a busy road so it is quite noisy.  Strangely, the pool is in the middle of the carpark!  The hotel has no restaurant but Denny's is next door.  We ate there once.  Food was good and a reasonable price.  There are numerous other restaurants a good 20-30 mins walk away plus a shopping mall.  We ate at PF Changs but felt rushed just like we were on a conveyor belt.  Food was ok but being rushed spoilt the experience.  Also ate at Fire and Ice where you picked your own food and had it cooked as you
Manager Response: We are centrally located in the Anaheim Resort Area, and across the way from Disneyland, so yes unfortuantely we are a distance from Los Angeles/Hollywood attractions, but we do have tours/transportation companie information available for our guests.  I am sorry that your tour you booked was not as long at each stop as you would of liked.  Glad to read your guest room was comfortable and enjoyable.  Thanks for the comments, it's comments/feedback such as your own that help us become more knowledgeable in guests needs.  We want to thank you for choosing Best Western Pavilions for your lodging needs, we hope to have you as a guest again.

Summary: We were very happy and satisfied with our stay at this property.  Very nice beds, room had a microwafe and fridge, good size bathroom.  Our shower had quite low pressure, the hotel suggested changing room immediately however we weren't that bothered so we stayed on our original room. It was about 10 mins brisk hike to entrance of Disneyland through a Disneyland parking lot which stayed open even until after midnight. You could take the monorail from Downtown DIsney to cut your walking distance. Cookies were available from the front desk every afternoon, nice ones too. TV channels availability was one the best we've experienced, got everything from cartoon to the Food channel.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for being our guest at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel, and are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary Heading: Very Comfortable beds and excellent room service
Summary: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Pavilions Best Western. The pool was cold and the hot tub was luke warm.  We had hotter water in our room and after so many hours of walking around in Disneyland,  I really needed to relax in a HOT tub. The guest laundry is not located on the property, I had to go 4 hotels down the block to the other Best Western. Which I didn't mind, except I was asked to pay for parking which was $12.00 or park my car at the entrance and walk the length of the hotel to where the guest laundry was located.  I was allowed to drive onto the property only after I disputed the charge and inconvenience. Otherwise, the comfort, cleanliness and service at the PAVILIONS  Best Western was excellent and the front desk clerks were nice and pleasant.
Manager Response: We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay with us, and we are thankful for bringing the parking cost to our attention, and glad they waived the fee.  We will be addressing this by stamping free parking on the passes we hand out to future guests.   Once again thank you for sharing your comments, and being our guest at the Best Western Pavilions Hotel.

Summary: After travelling for 20 hours it was nice to arrive to a very clean and comfortable motel room and friendly receptionists.  The beds were very comfortable and the room/bathroom was very clean.  The room was a perfect size for 3 of us.  Safe deposit box were also available. We were on the bottom floor close to reception and had no trouble with noise.  The location was also great with a bus stop for tours outside the motel and it was excellent that we could cross the road and walk thru the cast members carpark to get to Downtown Disney in 5 minutes.  They went out of there way to store our 6 large bags in a room on our last day as we didn't leave for the airport until 6pm.  We stayed here for 2 weeks.  We look forward to staying there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: my husband and I stayed here for 7 nights and again a week later for 1 night before flying home.The beds were so comfortable, the room was clean, fridge and microwave were clean also. The room was big enough for the 3 of us, though we only slept there, we were out all day.The location and price suited us and tour buses picked us up right outside. We did eat at  Denny's on our first night, (kids eat free), it was ok, nothing special, there are many restaurants close with nicer food and kids eat free at alot of them.The reception staff were lovely, especially one girl, I can't remember her name, was extremely helpful when we first arrived,when we discovered we had left a backpack on the shuttle bus.  we would definately stay there again, the only negative,it was stated that they
Manager Response: We are so pleased to read how much you enjoyed you stay with us, and the comfort of our beds.  Hopefully you will continue to us Best Western as your lodging needs while traveling.

Summary Heading: Room is better than exterior & location
Summary: I paid $76/night with AAA which was a so-so price.  The hotel is L-shaped with 2 floors, exterior halls, no elevators, and a small pool.  It had been recently renovated and my room was clean and in better shape than most 3-star hotels.  The room had a mini fridge and microwave.  The beds were very comfortable.  The exterior cheapens it all, especially the fact that Denny's is right beside the hotel.  I felt fairly safe until I saw a man digging through all of the trash cans which are plentiful.  There's an Anaheim Resort Transit bus stop at the hotel for transportation to Disneyland.  I think I'd stay again so long as I wasn't alone.  The staff was very friendly.  And my room was in the back corner of the grounds and I never heard any traffic.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked reservations 4 months ago for my husband's birthday and to include two days at Disneyland.  I felt that $85 was the highest I could go, considering the room was booked 4 months ago.  When we arrived we enjoyed the room, our two days at Disneyland, but I was extremely surprised to receive a telephone call about 15 minutes before we checked out asking for an "additional $5.00 charge".  They told my husband it was something to do with using the nearby resorts.  I thought that was pretty tacky, considering that I later found out that there were multiple hotels that were more reasonable, considering my budget.  I do not want to diminish that the hotel room was very comfortable, the bed exceedingly comfortable and everything else was just perfect.  Too bad the mood was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Would NOT recommend at any price
Summary: This is my first time writing a negative review but sadly, I feel compelled to write my comments based on a horrifying experience.  Last night my children and I awoke to the sounds of a man beating a woman outside our front door - literally - screaming and yelling.  Our walls were shaking - it sounded like he was throwing her up against my outside wall.  We were terrified.  The screaming and beating continued - AFTER 20 minutes OUTSIDE - in their room which was next door to our room.  Now this kind of situation can happen at ANY hotel at any time but what was shocking to me was that there is NO SECURITY at this hotel - no one came to "break it up" - My family was terrified.   When I inquired about this incident at the front desk this morning - the employee shrugged her shoulders

Summary: From the outside it looks like a regular motel, but newly renovated, it's pretty decent inside. Besides the bathroom (which could use a little renovation) the stay was wonderful, rooms clean and new, microwave and fridge very useful, and free wireless internet aswell. The walls seem like they are a bit thin, you can hear noices & voices from above (very minor) and the maids vaccuming in the morning but not that noticeable. For the price paid, the Pavilions was great and would definitly stay again. The front desk was very helpful in asking about car rentals and brochures, and the rooms were spotlessly cleaned by the time we got back to the hotel. The room was  nice, and the hotel was quiet..probably becaue everyone was sooo tired after walking back from Disneyland.    The walk is about the only down side to this hotel.  I would not  do it  with very young children.   The staff was  great. a   good  value.

Summary Heading: Stay elsewhere unless you like lung disease and bugs
Summary: Room and decor okay for low/moderate motel but photos are VERY decieving.  Handicap room okay, good bars in bathroom but hanidcap parking down at other end of motel instead of in front of handicap room - DUH!  Air conditioner so old the guy had to bang on it on it to get it to work and then shoved a peice of folded paper in to hold it in place.  Everytime it went on it sounded like a freight train all night long.  And the filth and mold on it was disgusting.    Never got the extra pillows I requested twice.  Maids don't speak a word of English but then the front desk only spoke broken English.   Main door to room had no rubber runner on the bottom and the full inch gap was more than enough for any size bug and small rodents to come in easliy so had to block it with a towel. Skip

Summary: Good service is hard to come by in general in Southern California. This hotel didn't give us the king size bed we asked for. Instead we got 2 queen sized. We found our room wasn't cleaned one evening. When we told to girl at the front desk she referred me to the manager the next morning instead of taking ownership of the problem. The next day we found ourselves locked out of our room because the access card was deavtiate. Another trip to the front desk and we were good.  On the good side, the rooms were clean and even stood up to an earthquake when we were there. I didn't see any insects at all on the entire property. The rooms look like something out of the 60's, but they remodeled and painted it well. Cable TV had tons of stations. I was a little disappointed to be sent down

Summary: Overall it was good stay all round. It in walking distance to downtown disney. It has a denny's diner next ot it and a liquor mart.  Overall pretty good value.

Summary: Best Western Pavillions was a good budget alternative to staying in one of the Disney hotels. It is a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. We found the room to be clean, although it had a stuffy smell. The airconditioner was quite noisy. It had a nice pool we swam in every day and there is a laundry available for use at the Best Western hotel about 100 metres away from the Pavillions. There was no breakfast included but it is next to a Denny's restaurant and a small drug store/supermarket which we found very convenient. It's not luxurious, but comfortable and good for visiting Disneyland.

Summary: This place looks like it should have been torn down in the 60's. TACKY!!  There were ants and roaches throughout the property, including in our room!  When we talked to the manager he said all the hotels have ants and that they weren't so bad.  The carpets were so dirty that our feet were black!!  There are several other Best Westerns in the area I would stay at one of these.  Buyer Beware!!

Summary Heading: Loved it do much we went back again and again!!
Summary: Stayed at pavillions in 1996 with my hubby and 2 toddlers. First time in US and I was a bit stressed about travelling with small kids. Pool was cold ( kids never mind) rooms were very clean ( compared to others we have now stayed in). Lots of Ausssies at Motel so that was cool hearing familiar accents. Dennys out the front is o.k. Food for Less supermarket is walking distance down Katella ( about 2 kilometers) but us Aussies seem to walk more than the locals,-everyone else drove! Went back in 2000 and it was just as good. Took the shuttle to Disney, swam everyday( summer!) Girl at front desk gave us good directions to The Block at Orange ( must see) and we drove evrywhere to shop. Am going back in 4 weeks and staying at Carousel ( part of our travel package) but our last free
